content: knitted patchwork recipe by martine ellis © copyright 2021 martine ellis all rights reserved martinemakes com about materials this knitting recipe is for a mitered square needle/s patchwork project what you do with your 2 75 mm us size 2 mitered squares is completely up to you you could make a blanket a scarf a cushion yarn cover… the possibilities are endless this recipe lots of leftover sock/fingering weight yarn explains how to knit and join your squares very approximately 2 5 grams/8 metres per square notions scissors stitch marker tapestry/yarn needle optional locked stitch marker to indicate rs of work you can purchase a starter kit containing everything you need to start this project including mini skeins of sock yarn here martinemakes etsy com a note on yarn and gauge this pattern was originally written to use up leftover sock yarn but it will work with any weight yarn just adjust your needle size and use the same weight yarn or thereabouts for each square while gauge is not important for this recipe as mentioned above it s recommended that you use a similar weight yarn for all your squares 2 abbreviations pattern notes k knit slip the first stitch of each row as if to knit with k2tog knit 2 together the exception of the first knitted row row 2 as k2tog tbl knit 2 together through the back loops this will be tricky to slip pm place marker rs right side your decreases only happen on the right side sm slip marker rs of the work consider marking the right ws wrong side side of your work with a locking stitch marker use the knitted cast on unless the pattern states otherwise 3 method making your first square row 1 rs cast on 16 stitches pm cast on a further 16 stitches 32 stitches in total row 2 ws k all stitches row 3 rs decrease row k until 2 stitches before the marker k2tog sm k2tog tbl k to the diagram above shows the order in which end of row the diamonds were knitted 1 2 3 then 4 see page 6 for a picture tutorial row 4 ws k all
